thread.title: House Calls Yield Bilateral Joy and Healing Connection

author: wsjcom
title: House Calls Yield Bilateral Joy and Healing Connection
text: At 71, I’m a relative pup compared with the delightful country doctor Charles Kemper (“A Country Doctor Can’t Forget His 40 Years of House Calls” by Bob Greene, op-ed Feb. 9), yet I have discovered the fulfillment of the house call after 35 years as a family physician in a cushy suburban practice. New reimbursement models are allowing me to grab my care team (R.N. and social worker), toss my roller bag in the back seat of my SUV, go back to my Detroit roots and spend meaningful time with generally housebound lonely, frail, elderly patients in and around the city. Like Dr. Kemper, I, too, see relief in my patients’...
